title: The Desert War: Fighting Rommel - The Afrika Korps
description: Comprehensive documentary covering the North African desert war and Rommel's Afrika Korps campaign, from the initial victories to the fierce battles against Allied forces.

title: The Complete Timeline Of The WW2 North African Campaign
description: Complete 3+ hour documentary covering the entire North African Campaign from the Italian invasion through the final Allied victory in Tunisia.

title: Battlefield S2/E1 - The Battle for North Africa
description: Classic Battlefield documentary series episode covering the entire North African Campaign with archival footage and expert analysis.

title: Why Germany Lost the Battle for North Africa
description: Analysis of why the Afrika Korps ultimately lost in North Africa, examining logistics, strategy, and the turning points of the campaign.

title: How Rommel became the Desert Fox | Operation Sonnenblume
description: Imperial War Museum's analysis of how Erwin Rommel earned his reputation as the Desert Fox through his audacious first offensive in Libya.

title: Rommel | The Soldier, The Son, And Hitler
description: Documentary exploring Rommel's military career, personal life, and complex relationship with Hitler's regime.

title: The Mediterranean And North Africa
description: After success in North Africa and Greece, Allies push Mussolini's forces all the way back to Italy. Comprehensive look at the Mediterranean theater.

title: The Battle of El Alamein | IWM
description: Imperial War Museum's expert analysis of the decisive Second Battle of El Alamein that turned the tide in North Africa.

title: The Desert War: Fighting Rommel - The British Victory
description: Part 2 of the desert war documentary covering Montgomery's command and the British victory at El Alamein.

title: The Afrika Korps - Rommel's Desert Army
description: Quick overview of the Deutsches Afrikakorps, its formation, major battles, and ultimate defeat in Tunisia.

title: How Did The SAS Transform The Second World War?
description: Imperial War Museum explores how David Stirling created the SAS in the North African desert and their daring raids behind enemy lines.

title: Operation Torch - The Allied Invasion of North Africa
description: Animated coverage of Operation Torch, the American and British landings in French North Africa that trapped Rommel between two armies.

title: Anti-Tank Chats: The German 88mm
description: Tank Museum curator explains the legendary German 88mm gun and its devastating use as an anti-tank weapon in the desert.

title: The Desert Rats - Britain's Elite 7th Armoured Division
description: The story of the famous British 7th Armoured Division who earned their 'Desert Rats' nickname in North Africa.

title: Tank Chats #19 Matilda II | The Tank Museum
description: Tank Museum's detailed look at the Matilda II, the 'Queen of the Desert' that proved impervious to Italian anti-tank guns.

title: Tank Chats #106 | Panzer IV | The Tank Museum
description: Detailed examination of the Panzer IV, the most effective German tank in North Africa when equipped with the long 75mm gun.
